title: Moon Martin - The Very Best Of Moon Martin (1999)@flac
description:
Thirty years after most of these songs were recorded, they still sound vibrant and powerful; gorgeous pop music that took wings and soared, thanks to Martin's scorching electric guitar playing and warm vocals. Like honey-glazed ribs and whiskey. 
Moon Martin may have looked like a geek, with his huge, round eyeglasses and bowl-cut hairdo, but his music packed a delicious power-pop punch. But in the music business, regardless of your talent, your "look" is often the factor in determining your success, thus, homely Moon Martin was left out in the cold, despite a flair for writing ultra-catchy songs. 
Robert Palmer went on to have a mega-hit with Martin's "Bad Case of Lovin' You," and even the band Mink DeVille enjoyed success with a cover of "Cadillac Walk," but I still prefer the Moon Martin versions. And those two songs comprise just a fraction of the treasure trove of musical jewels that Moon Martin wrote and performed during his abbreviated career. 
You can't go wrong with this CD: it really is a fine "Best of" collection.  (Customer from Amazon)
